description: MPST deficiency promotes intestinal epithelial cell apoptosis and aggravates inflammatory bowel disease.
MPST expression was markedly decreased in colonic samples from patients with ulcerative colitis.
MPST expression was markedly decreased in colonic samples from patients with Crohn's disease.
Mechanistically, MPST directly interacted with AKT and reduced the phosphorylation of AKT.
AKT plays a role in regulating apoptosis in intestinal epithelial cells during inflammatory bowel disease.
Inhibition of MPST significantly increased the expression of proinflammatory cytokines when HT29 cells were treated with TNF-α.
